programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Heading for the Tian Shan range The two-day coach ride from Ürümqi to the Tian Shan mountains requires a great deal of patience from the climbers but the landscapes and the people they meet make it worth it. They finally spot the Tian Shan foothills. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc: Spotlight on headgear by La Cerise sur le Chapeau. All there is to know about the roll neck. Encounter with André Sakellarides, stringed-instrument maker in Marseille. How to wear wellington boots. A deliciously sweet visit to a veritable institution in Lille: Maison Meert reveals the recipe for its waffles. Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
François Gagnaire
Chef François Gagnaire, today based in Paris, returns to the Haute-Loire and his town of Le Puy-en-Velay, where he has never been forgotten. We accompany him on a distinctly foodie pilgrimage, across the region that revealed his talent and where he earned his first Michelin star.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a multigenerational farm In Saskatchewan, Julien settles on a farm that's totally off-grid and into the radically ecological lifestyle of its inhabitants. And he's about to learn a lot from this family that lives its convictions to the full! Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Cité du Vin in Bordeaux. Encounter with the French Michelin-starred chef Guy Savoy in his restaurant at the Monnaie de Paris. Three addresses for all things Greek. Alice Riehl brings porcelain out of the kitchen to create a host of poetic sculptures and murals. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.sub-title: Nathanaël Désormeaux et Damien Carrette/Le verre
programme.desc: Encounter with Nathanaël Désormeaux and Damien Carrette who open the doors to their world of design with its fun pop ambiance. Thomas Segaud, glass-blower, recounts his passion. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: At the foot of Xuelian Feng The team face a two-day walk to reach the base camp at 3,500 metres in altitude. The climbers are accompanied by half a dozen Uighur riders and 22 heavily laden horses. Upon arrival, the weather changes quickly and Xuelian Feng's peak disappears... Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 9:

Place Vendôme, spotlight on the jeweller Lorenz Bäumer. All there is to know about the kiss. Chausse Mouton has turned the traditional French carpet slipper into a modern accessory, whilst continuing to respect traditional French techniques. How to wear a sweater dress? Portrait of Roger Vincent, pipe carver in Saint-Claude.

Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Succulent !
programme.desc:
Rum baba
We rediscover this great classic desert: the rum baba. And even when prepared completely by the book, a little touch of fantasy is always possible, such as today's recipe, flavoured with rhubarb wine.
Presented by: Marie Montuir

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a floating island We head to Freedom Cove, a floating island built thirty years ago by Catherine and Wayne, a couple of artists. Impressed by the audacity of the project, Julien explores the challenges of life on the water, totally independent in terms of energy and food. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Welcome to the Paris City Hall, or Hôtel de Ville. Consume less but consume better, we discover the new paradigm in the world of alternative fashion. An encounter with Sakina M'Sa, enlightened designer and businesswoman. How to say it with flowers? Focus on the "makhila", the distinctive Basque walking stick. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: The plastic artist Éva Jospin takes us on an expedition through the heart of her cardboard forests and other contemporary works. The Middle Ages seem so very far away? Focus on a technique inherited from the period: illumination. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: At the foot of Xuelian Feng The team face a two-day walk to reach the base camp at 3,500 metres in altitude. The climbers are accompanied by half a dozen Uighur riders and 22 heavily laden horses. Upon arrival, the weather changes quickly and Xuelian Feng's peak disappears... Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Muffin recipes
Ricardo suggests a selection of muffin recipes for a filling snack easy to eat on the go: apricot muffins, sweetcorn muffins and pear, date and cream cheese muffins.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Cordouan lighthouse that guards the mouth of the Gironde estuary. Encounter with Jean-Michel Othoniel, artist, creating poetical yet militant sculptures. A stroll through Paris to discover some of its best Art Nouveau addresses. Focus on Aurore Thuault, a textile designer turning embroidery into contemporary art. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.sub-title: Nathanaël Désormeaux et Damien Carrette/Le verre
programme.desc: Encounter with Nathanaël Désormeaux and Damien Carrette who open the doors to their world of design with its fun pop ambiance. Thomas Segaud, glass-blower, recounts his passion. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
A visit to the Cognacq-Jay Museum, home to the 18th century artworks collected by Ernest Cognacq and Marie-Louise Jay. Interior designer Bruno Borrione advocates an uninhibited style using materials with character. Glenn Martens brings a fresh look to the Jean Paul Gaultier fashion house. All the expertise of Peruke.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Croustade aux pommes et aux courges
programme.desc: Apple and squash croustade Blake Mackay prepares a croustade that combines squash and apple to perfection. And to ensure nothing goes to waste, the apple skins and core are used to create home-made vinegar. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Bungalow Built to house families after the baby-boom, Quebec's bungalows are typical of the suburbs, each with their rectangular layout, basement and carport. Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Cité du Vin in Bordeaux. Encounter with the French Michelin-starred chef Guy Savoy in his restaurant at the Monnaie de Paris. Three addresses for all things Greek. Alice Riehl brings porcelain out of the kitchen to create a host of poetic sculptures and murals. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Creemore, Ontario
Around fifty bats have taken up residence in an old house. Louis' mission is to gently move them out.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Moi j'mange
programme.desc:
Growing in my garden!
On the menu: Greek salad with tofu feta, melon and mint gazpacho, Korean-style grilled vegetables and chicken.
Presented by: Stéphane Bellavance. Directed by: Patrice Ouimet (season 2, Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Karen Swami has her feet firmly on the ground and both hands in the earth. An encounter with a ceramist unlike any other. The bronze medal may not be the most prestigious, but the metal used to make it is far more precious than you might think... Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 2
Viola begins by offering us a tour of an amazing house, its roof and walls covered by solar panels. Then she visits a surprising home-workshop-studio belonging to an artist-shepherd and a magnificent villa with direct lake access and an owner who is somewhat unusual ... to say the least.
Presented by: Viola Tami. Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)
